info.author: Luke Newcomb
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU General Public License v3 (GPLv3)
info.description:
# kobjdump
A small program to dump KerbalObject files to a human readable format, similar in function to tools like `readelf` or `dumpobj` but only for use with KerbalObject files. Useful for debugging when generating KO files for the langauge of your choice.

For a description of the format of KerbalObject files, see [kobjectlib/docs](https://github.com/etherealfryingpan/kobjectlib "kobjectlib GitHub page")

---

Tested using Python 3.6.9

This project is a Python module, so if using from the source it must be run with:

`python3 -m kobjdump [args]`

Although this can also be installed from PyPi:

`pip3 install kobjdump`

So it can be run as such:

`kobjdump [args]`

This will be the format that will be used throughout these docs

---

## `Module documentation:`

Help can be acquired by:

`kobjdump --help`

---

### `Arguments:`

Specifies an input KerbalObject (.ko) file that will be read  
`kobjdump` `-i` / `--input-file` `FILE_PATH`

Can only be used seperately  
This argument specifies for `kobjdump` to create a sample KO file that contains at least one type of every section, although it will NOT be valid for linking. It is simply to show what each section will look like.  
A file called `sample.ko` will be created in the current working directory.

`kobjdump --generate-sample`

---

If you have any questions / suggestions for this project, let me know.
info.name: kobjdump
info.summary: Python program for dumping KerbalObject files.
info.html_description:
kobjdump

A small program to dump KerbalObject files to a human readable format, similar in function to tools like readelf or dumpobj but only for use with KerbalObject files. Useful for debugging when generating KO files for the langauge of your choice.

For a description of the format of KerbalObject files, see kobjectlib/docs

Tested using Python 3.6.9

This project is a Python module, so if using from the source it must be run with:

python3 -m kobjdump [args]

Although this can also be installed from PyPi:

pip3 install kobjdump

So it can be run as such:

kobjdump [args]

This will be the format that will be used throughout these docs

Module documentation:

Help can be acquired by:

kobjdump --help

Arguments:

Specifies an input KerbalObject (.ko) file that will be read
kobjdump -i / --input-file FILE_PATH

Can only be used seperately
This argument specifies for kobjdump to create a sample KO file that contains at least one type of every section, although it will NOT be valid for linking. It is simply to show what each section will look like.
A file called sample.ko will be created in the current working directory.

kobjdump --generate-sample

If you have any questions / suggestions for this project, let me know.
